text: Notas a vainilla desde el primero trago, la cocoa y el café abundaban de le dan cuerpo. Gran stout.

Bottle shared in London / thanks to Fergus. Pours reddish brown with a foamy, khaki head. Rush coffee aroma, some milk chocolate, soft roast. Medium sweet flavour with some milk chocolate, coffee ice cream, mellow earthy bitterness, accents if dried berries. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Well balanced finish, with more hearty coffee, some more ice cream, vanilla cream, mild bitterness, just a little boozy warmth. Great stuff.

22oz bottle acquired from City Beer Store (San Francisco, CA). Opened in a University of Illinois parking lot. More deadened nose, gorgeous pour, good flavors, flow, touch ofcsticky and toasty malt, touch of body, firm adjuncts and sweeter flavors meld and sustain well. Tasty stuff.

Malty aroma with a hint of coffee and cocoa. Pours almost black. Nice treacley taste with coffee and chocolate joining the party. First few mouthful left a bitter aftertaste, almost like stale coffee, but seems to be improving as I drink a little more, perhaps because it is warming a tiny bit, or losing its fizz slightly. Think this would be good as a nitro to smooth out the bitterness. (K)
Dark brown color. Tons of coffee and cocoa, very malty nose. Vanilla and coffee are super strong but too cold right now. Very malty lots of caramel, but too sweet and a bit cloying. Not bad

Brown colored, moderate sized head, decent lace/retention. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, caramel, sugar. Medium bodied, the added flavors make this pretty nice. Loose take on a brown ale but I liked it.
Bottle from Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours dark brown with a thick tan head and a coffee and treacle aroma. There is a medium-bodied chocolate malt flavor with some chocolate and coffee finish.

Pours a deep brown color with a khaki head. Coffee, caramel, toffee, chocolate, biscuit, toast, vanilla and earthy aroma. Fudge, cocoa, coffee, caramel, toast, biscuit, roasted malt, vanilla and nutty flavors. Medium full body and average carbonation. Fudge, coffee, toast, caramel and nut finish. Very tasty.
Bottle. Pours clear chestnut, small beige head, good lacing. Aroma is roasty, coffee, cocoa, hints of vanilla. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, coffee, mocha, roasty. Medium body. Good.

Bomber poured into a tulip glass, Reddish brown with a khaki tan head, with some lacing. Black coffee, dark cocoa powder, vanilla beans, black licorice, graham cracker, and dark chocolate. A very nice brown ale would recommend to friends!

Bottle at home. Pours dark brown to black with a medium, frothy and bubbly beige head, long retention with spare to no lacing. Aroma is moderate earthy coffee, bitter chocolate, nutty, vanilla, toast malt and light earthy hops. Flavor is toast malt, light earthy hops and bitterness, vanilla, nutty, earthy coffee, bread crust and a dry finish. Medium body, thin and light carbonation.

Bottle from BevMo! in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is mild coffee, chocolate, vanilla. Taste is more vanilla and chocolate than coffee. Really smooth but a little underwhelming especially consider this is from Modern Times AND Drakes Electric Owl is on another level compared to this.

22 ounce bottle purchased at The Davis Beer Shoppe. The aroma on this has sweet chocolate notes with a little underlying roast and minimal coffee. Beneath that is a little husky malt character. Pretty nice. Transparent cola-colored body with a small to medium light tan head. Starts with some fairly sweet chocolate flavors, before this has a little roasted coffee in the middle. Finishes with some nuttiness and almost a dry, papery mouthfeel. Light astringency late. This is pretty good, as far as brown ales go. They dressed it up pretty well.

Big aromas of coal and coffee. Deep thick mahogany block most light. Thin but lasting light head. Super smooth brown coco to coffee transition that vanilla slides in on and adds to as they all fade together. Has the body of a cup of coffee.

Type: 22-oz. bottle
Glass: Clear 14.75-oz. porter/stout glass
From: Trader Joes in La Mesa (San Diego), Calif.
Price: $6.99
Purchased: Oct. 7, 2016
Consumed: Oct. 9, 2016
Reviewed as: American Brown Ale
Misc.: Bottled on Sept. 25, 2016 (I think, it was tough to read)

Was eyeing this when I saw their release calendar, but forgot about it until I got an email from them in late September. This was pretty much right up my alley. Coffee, vanilla and cocoa nibs, and Modern Times? Had high hopes on this one.

Poured a reddish brown amber-to-light brown color with three fingers of khaki tan frothy lacing. Could see some bubbles coming up along the sides despite the dark color. Excellent-to-world-class uneven spiderweb lacing. Excellent retention. A very good looking beer. (Sight - 4.50)

Smelled a nice mix of flavors, in order getting cocoa nibs, black coffee powder, bitter dark chocolate, char wood, burnt toast, vanilla beans, roasted malts, ashtray, black licorice, wood chips, some oats and hints of Cheerios cereal. (Smell - 4.00)

Taste followed the nose nicely. Definitely another solid coffee offering from Modern Times. Got bitter black coffee, dark cocoa powder, char wood, some ashtray, burnt toast, vanilla beans, anise, black licorice, roasty malts and dark chocolate fudge. (Taste - 4.25)

Medium-to-full body. Creamy texture. Average carbonation. Long, roasty, bitter finish. (Feel - 4.25)

Pretty much about as good as I expected. Just a very good coffee beer. Would love to see a BBA version of this. (Overall - 4.25)

4.21 94 A-

22 oz bottle poured into a tulip. Bottled 9/28/2016. Labeled as Sleepless City, Brown Ale with coffee, cocoa nibs & vanilla beans added. Very dark brownish color but not quite black, about a finger of light tan head. Aromas of roasted coffee, dark chocolate, light vanilla, coffee cake. Tastes of slightly sweet roasted coffee, slightly bitter dark chocolate, light vanilla, some malt. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Pretty tasty.
You can do a lot with beer! And Modern Times does it! This is an outstanding example of a coffee brown ale. A very nice treat. 22oz bottle
(En fût au Flavordome): Une base de biscuit graham enduit de fudge riche, dune membrane vanillée et dune descente torréfiée juste à point.
yeah...really nice coffee, and the smooth cocoa and vanilla and body just adds to it. Light roast, A little bitter and a little sweet. Big fan.
Growler thanks to Dan. Pours a very dark brown with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is strong roast, cocoa, vanilla bean. Medium mouth, similar flavors to nose, bitter finish, very good.

[ Cask ][ 12oz ][ Modern Times ][ $6 ][ Fat Cylinder ][ 12.11.14 ]
>> Clear, deep red pour. Tremendous foam. Really nice nose of dense vanilla, grilled strawberry, toasted macadamia. Served a bit too cold, so nose really opens up after it warms. Taste has mild paper, anesthetic, weak sauce compared to the aroma. Heavy roast though, light stout like flavor. Medium light body, light coffee derived acid perhaps in the finish.
